data.text: The government
Pakistan became an independent country on 14 August 1947.
Pakistan became a democratic country. The democracy is based on the ideals of Islam.
In a democracy, people elect leaders to rule the country.
Elections are held every 5 years and people above 18 years of age can vote.
Through voting, people elect members of the national and provincial assemblies.
The members of the national and provincial assemblies elect the members of the Senate, which is the upper house.
The prime minister is the head of the government.
The chief minister is the head of a province. The chief minister appoints his own ministers.

A constitution is a set of rules which everyone in the country must follow.
A constitution helps the people of a country to stop any party from staying in power all the time or making their own laws.
The president is the head of the state. His duty is to see that the country is being run in accordance with the rules of the constitution.
Each province is headed by a governor who makes sure that the provincial assembly is also following the rules of the constitution.
Important matters such as laws for the whole country are debated in the National Assembly.
